title: China: Citi Supports Microfinance Program in Gansu
summary: Lanzhou, China - Citibank (China) Co. Ltd. ("Citi China") today announced its support for the Gansu Living & Learning Microfinance Program ("The Program").
tag-1: China: Citi Supports Microfinance Program in Gansu
tag-2: Lanzhou, China – Citibank (China) Co. Ltd. ("Citi China") today announced its support for the Gansu Living & Learning Microfinance Program ("The Program").
tag-3: Sponsored by the Citi Foundation, the program, conducted through China Foundation for Poverty Alleviation Microfinance (CFPA Microfinance) in cooperation with the Hezheng County Poverty Alleviation and Development Office, aims to use financial assistance to improve local residents' living standards through sustainable income generating activities.
tag-4: Ouyang Jian, Deputy Party Chief of Gansu Province, Ran Wanxiang, Vice Governor of Gansu Province, Duan Yingbi, Chairman of CFPA, Du Wei of CBRC, Huang Jie, Executive Vice President of Citi China, and guests from the local government and the local poverty alleviation office attended the launch ceremony held in Lanzhou today.
tag-5: Andrew Au, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Citi China, said, "Citi is delighted to be part of this meaningful initiative as we are committed to playing an active role in supporting local development and improving financial access to underserved individuals and households. Citi has a longstanding involvement in the microfinance space, both in China and around the world, and we aim to help build stronger communities where we build our business."
tag-6: Adopting CFPA's microfinance model, the Gansu Living & Learning Microfinance Program aims to provide 1,500 poor households in villages of Hezheng County with microcredit loans for income generating activities, so as to increase farmers' income levels and to create permanent job opportunities. Additionally, training focusing on agricultural and animal husbandry technology and livelihood will be conducted to help farmers create or expand existing household enterprises.
tag-7: Through the microcredit loans and newly acquired skills, farmers in Hezheng are expected to be able to increase their annual average income by 10 percent-25 percent by the end of the program. Since January 2013, the program has already disbursed RMB 1 million in total to 125 qualified households in Hezheng County.
tag-8: Mr. Duan Yingbi, Chairman of CFPA Microfinance, said, "Since signing the partnership memorandum in October 2012, our program in Gansu has been progressing smoothly and continues to expand beyond our expectation. We're grateful for the support from the Provincial Government of Gansu, CBRC and Citi Foundation, and we're confident our program will help achieve our goal to support the poverty alleviation effort of Gansu ."
tag-9: Microfinance has proved to be an effective way to improve peoples' lives through economic self-sufficiency and the reduction of financial vulnerability. Citi Foundation has been a leading supporter of microfinance for more than 26 years around the world, providing financial and capability support to more than 300 microfinance and microenterprise programs in 60 countries over the past 10 years or so.
tag-10: In China, through the support of the Citi Foundation, Citi has helped to establish the China Association of Microfinance and Microfinance Training Center and to support the capacity building of the microfinance sector. In 2005, Citi helped to establish the Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards in partnership with the China Banking Association, to recognize the efforts of microentrepreneurs while also raising awareness of the importance of microfinance efforts to increase access to finance. The annual awards program has become the largest and most influential event for Chinese microfinance practitioners to interact with and learn from each other.
tag-11: Hezheng County is located in the south of Linxia Hui Autonomous Prefecture in Gansu Province with a poverty-stricken population of 13.95 million people, of which 2.6 million people live in absolute poverty.
tag-12: CFPA MF Launched in 1996, with the strong support of the State Council Leading Group Office of Poverty Alleviation and Development, CFPA started poverty alleviation microfinance projects with aim to build farmers' ability to be independent and increase their incomes.
tag-13: At the end of 2008, CFPA founded a subsidiary, CFPA Microfinance Management Co., Ltd., specialized in the management and implementation of the microfinance projects.
tag-14: CFPA Microfinance has become the largest non-profit institution specialized in microfinance. As of the end of April, 2013, CFPA Microfinance branches are located in 15 provinces, covering 74 cities or counties, with a total loan balance of more than 1 billion yuan, nearly 150,000 active clients. Since 1996, when CFPA launched its microfinance project, the cumulative number of loans distributed is 563,768 amounting 4.3 billion yuan, for the benefit of nearly 150 million poverty population.
tag-15: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-17: Citi China  Citi first established an office in China on May 15, 1902, in Shanghai. In April 2007, Citi was among the first international banks to locally incorporate in China. Citi's locally incorporated entity is known as Citibank (China) Co Ltd, which is wholly owned by Citibank N.A. Today Citi is a leading international bank in China, and has 13 corporate bank branches – in Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Shenzhen, Tianjin, Chengdu, Hangzhou, Dalian, Chongqing, Guiyang, Nanjing, Changsha and Wuxi – and 51 consumer bank outlets. With operations in more than 160 countries around the world, Citi is the most global of all international banks in China.
tag-18: Citi Foundation The Citi Foundation is committed to the economic empowerment of individuals and families, particularly those in need, in the communities where we work so that they can improve their standard of living. Globally, the Citi Foundation targets its strategic giving on its priority focus areas: Microfinance and Microenterprise, Small and Growing Businesses, Education, and Financial Education and Asset Building. The Citi Foundation works with its partners in Microfinance and Microenterprise and Small and Growing Businesses to support environmental programs and innovations. Additional information can be found at www.citifoundation.com.
